that PERMIT AWARDED for INCINERATOR üé•‚¨áÔ∏è

https://t.co/LLdf0Zq4LV

The EA let me know the 500 Poplar trees on the coast path towards Aust will be destroyed next week. As will the hedgerow. Tried everything but there you go, it‚Äôs happening anyway. We achieved a great level of mitigation ie new trees planted.  more on that soon. 2020 hey? üòì üå≥

Take your knowledge further with a Flood and Coastal Engineering MSc. 

Scholarships are available, full time for one year starting in September 2021 and will include a 3 month work placement at the @EnvAgency (subject to terms and conditions).

Apply now: https://t.co/cStzUAbhhi https://t.co/eoVU9cFApj

Great news this morning supporting our initiative working with the @EnvAgencySE and the community tacking the wider challenges of litter at Chessel Bay #Southampton #GreenCity #Microplastics https://t.co/WyMqBh7xfI
@TerryMac999 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Sorry to have missed it.
@eabroken2020 @EnvAgency That's unfair and you should know it. It was Mr Price that felled these trees not @EnvAgency Cheap shot!

As part of the River Esk Restoration Project staff have been tree planting in Ainthorpeüå±üíô

It's hoped to improve water quality and create habitat for many species of wildlife. The project is passionate about green engineering and working with nature üåç@EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/rsJyq3scnA

Would your business stay afloat in a flood? Take action to protect it.

Make a plan https://t.co/ncZ11T6Zlf

Outdated flood sirens in #Grimsby and #Cleethorpes will not be used from 31 December.

Read more https://t.co/apYdmzTrnS https://t.co/YmokICcBsj

#TeamEA have been out today clearing debris from river grids like here on the Wirral. 

Removing leaves and other debris from rivers allows them to flow freely without obstruction üçÇ https://t.co/eNw0PBk6lV

The wetland @CroxtethHall is working well. Lots more capacity to help reduce #flood risk. Imagine the impact if there were a series of ponds like this all the way along the watercourse! #NFM @EnvAgencyNW @ccnw1 @cpvolgroup @lpoolcouncil https://t.co/0h3xCFT1Ze
@_RobbieMoore @AireIncinerator @EnvAgency @IlkleyChat Any chance of some mass testing? And a roadmap out of tier 3?

Amazing talk by @Feargal_Sharkey on the disastrous neglect by policymakers and @EnvAgency of the Cam and other rivers. Tells us to take inspiration for a civic fight back from the Northern Ireland Civil Rights Movement.

Many fish species #willtravelforgravel - examples of gravel riffles & glides installed on the upper #RiverTest catchment this season thanks to EU funding from the @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland #WaterEnvironmentGrant scheme #RiverRestoration #Spawning https://t.co/1NvMgGi6zR

Massive thanks to Catherine Wright of the @EnvAgency & Alex Codd of @Hullccnews for speaking at @NicBrentUKCG hosted event on UK aproaches to Adaptation & Resilience - great scope for UK-US collaboration. tweets.text:
Great news in the Courier yesterday about #brearleyfields ! This is a great floodplain reconnection project with accessible wetland habitat. 
@CalderCountry @EnvAgencyYNE @slowtheflow_UK @YorksWildlife  https://t.co/d3yOZK8Bnp

@Feargal_Sharkey I have never seen anything like it on the Lugg nor the Arrow in my lifetime. This man must have not been well. There is a chance this was some kind of desperate breakdown. Why didn‚Äôt the EA did not stop it when first told?

@ProfJGrey @WildTroutTrust @BradfordsBecks @bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE @EAGeomorphology @aireriverstrust @PeteTurnerEA @fishmigration @PaulNGaskell @Theo_Pike Looks like classic West Yorkshire trout habitat to me, it'll surprise you and be lifting with fish....... ü§î

Definitely in need of some Natural Flood Management work! #NFM We're working with our partners to come up with some project ideas here @cpvolgroup @EnvAgencyNW @merseyforest #flooding https://t.co/4k7NefK1KX

tweets.text: Can‚Äôt believe this used to be the #RiverTrent. Thanks to all involved in the #ERDF #SUNRISEproject for all the work to divert the river‚Äôs course and bring much needed wildlife back to the river üëçüèª @SoTCityCouncil @StaffsWildlife @EnvAgencyMids @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/kHHlNPouYB
Great work going on in #ChelmsleyWood https://t.co/URGNaiZ6L6

@adamprice_h @WildTroutTrust @BradfordsBecks @bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE @EAGeomorphology @aireriverstrust @PeteTurnerEA @fishmigration @PaulNGaskell @Theo_Pike Ah but this isn't a SSSI.... unless we redefine it as Seriously Soddin' Straight Innit

@ProfJGrey @WildTroutTrust @BradfordsBecks @bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE @EAGeomorphology @aireriverstrust @PeteTurnerEA @fishmigration @PaulNGaskell @Theo_Pike I‚Äôve heard using 18 ton bulldozers is all the rage for river restoration nowadays üòÖüòÖüòÖ

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW
@TheMichaelMoran @FreyaLouisa @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency There‚Äôs so little protection or punishment for environmental vandalism, the perpetrators probably just assumed they‚Äôd get away with it..

#IYMI we‚Äôre giving ¬£3.9 million to #PlantMoreTrees outside of woodlands, in our cities, towns and rivers. 

Watch our video to find out more üëá
https://t.co/PuTzpXbZrB 

@EnvAgency #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/YTexLSWSVk

Very cheap shot _so is telling lies like what the EA do @EnvAgency they allow for river pollution,don‚Äôt obey regulators guidelines don‚Äôt dredge our rivers like they should and have caused many companies to close without good cause! https://t.co/6Ojid96ln9

@JorvikAngler @WildTroutTrust @BradfordsBecks @bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE @EAGeomorphology @aireriverstrust @PeteTurnerEA @fishmigration @PaulNGaskell @Theo_Pike It's very straight - forward & backward

@timthefruit When did the @EnvAgency ever do anything useful ?

#RiverLugg Mr Price claims not to have cut any trees down. I guess these just committed arboricide by deliberately throwing themselves at a running chainsaw that a careless trespasser left behind.ü§î https://t.co/rXpSW13Y2I

#IYMI we‚Äôre putting ¬£1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.  

Read more: https://t.co/Gf0f3pyncy  

#PlantMoreTrees #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/jQvvNELLdy

#Flooding affects millions worldwide and the future needs more engineers. 

Join @BrunelUni and @EnvAgency on Friday 11 Dec 10am BST to hear what it‚Äôs like to study a sponsored degree in Flood and Coastal Engineering and ask questions.  

Register now: https://t.co/SCyzVeQUb8 https://t.co/gyREs0SI4u
@CraigBennett3 @IoloWilliams2 @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts I would say it‚Äôs done to stop flooding looks a lot better plant appropriate trees there now will look good

Lessons in river hydrology - dredging a river increases flow exacerbating flood peaks to make flooding more likely. SLOW the flow. The landowner knows what is best for his/her farm business. The EA has to take a wider view. @HerefordshireWT @EnvAgency https://t.co/Vj6w0X4y8k

tweets.text: Out inspecting @EnvAgencyNW raingauges again, this one a lesser spotted Pluvio gauge at Abbeytown. Unusually, for our Cumbria gauges, this suffers from over exposure looking across the north Cumbrian plains. A wind shield is required to reduce the effects of the wind. @metoffice https://t.co/0Xj8XZAb1d

Hot off the press; Ryevitalise loves trees üå≥! Through   Woodlands for Water, we'll be planting over 12,800 of them in the River Rye Catchment, helping improve water quality and habitat. Watch this spruce for updates... @EnvAgencyYNE @northyorkmoors #ryevitalise https://t.co/Qcr4XBL4pP
